publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2210# Rosie Kane: Infringement of Civil Libertiesâ€”That the Parliament believes that the introduction of voluntary/compulsory ID cards is a gross infringement of civil liberties and considers that their introduction should be resisted by all MSPs, including by the use of direct action and civil disobedience, and by the use of protest and demonstration. Supported by: Patrick Harvie*, Carolyn Leckie*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-2210# Infringement of Civil Liberties (lodged on 23 December 2004) Frances Curran*
S2M-2210# Infringement of Civil Liberties (lodged on 23 December 2004) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-2210 # Infringement of Civil Liberties (lodged on 23 December 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
